roleset.name: make (more) suitable, becoming or making more accustomed or suitable, cause to fit
roleset.note: ADAPT-V NOTES: Member of Vncls adjust-26.9. (from adapt.01-v)
ADAPTION-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. (from adaption.01-n)

example.name: unstated goal or source
example.text: William Gates and Paul Allen in 1975 developed an early language-housekeeper system for PCs, and Gates became an industry billionaire six years after IBM adapted one of these versions in 1981.

example.name: arg1 defaults to reflexive on arg0
example.text: And [surprising numbers of small investors]-1 seem *trace*-1 to be adapting to greater stock market volatility and say they can live with program trading.

example.name: with source
example.text: [This article]-1 is adapted *trace*-1 from one in the October American Spectator.
example.arg: from one in the October American Spectator

example.name: Arg0,2
example.text: He felt that one of the important factors in his adaptation to a hearing aid at this time was that he finally got the nerve to admit he had hearing loss to his family and friends.

example.name: Arg0,1
example.text: Alexandre Aja talks about his adaptation of the space opera Cobra the Space Pirate.
example.arg: of the space opera Cobra the Space Pirate
